lyrics.lyric: Water gray
Through the windows, up the stairs
Chilling rain
Like an ocean, everywhere
Don't want to reach for me, do you?
I mean nothing to you
The little things give you away
And now there will be no mistaking
The levees are breaking
All you've ever wanted was someone to truly look up to you
And six feet underwater, I do
Hope decays
Generations disappear
Washed away
As a nation simply stares

And six feet underground, now I, now I do
Little things give you away

title: The Little Things Give You Away

annotations.referent: The little things give you away
annotations.annotation: Chester (from the POV of the victim) says that little things like these show your fakeness and hypocrisy. Secondly, it refers to the plethora of speeches Presidents and Prime Ministers deliver to their nations in trying times.

annotations.referent:
And six feet underground
 Now I, now I do
annotations.annotation: Clever usage of the “six feet under” expression again. The expression “six feet under” refers to the state of being dead and buried.

annotations.referent:
Water grey
 Through the windows, up the stairs
 Chilling rain
 Like an ocean, everywhere
annotations.annotation: This describes the devastation of the storm brought by Hurricane Katrina, such as the horrible floods and rains.

The metaphor of a levee breaking is again being utilized as a double entendre. The floods from Katrina obviously broke many levees – literally!But also it means that the people are fed up by these liars and their lack of trustworthiness.

annotations.referent:
All you’ve ever wanted
 Was someone to truly look up to you
 And six feet underwater, I do
annotations.annotation: Many, if not most politicians are hungry for power, money, or fame. Many, if not most people in representative democracies also tend to realize this, so they do not really look up to their political leaders.

annotations.referent:
Don’t want to reach for me, do you?
 I mean nothing to you
annotations.annotation: For some politicians, the people they are supposed to lead are nothing more than votes. Instead of working together to provide help to victims of national disaster, politicians squabble over mindless party divisions.

annotations.referent:
Hope decays
 Generations disappear
 Washed away
 As a nation simply stares
annotations.annotation: The lines state a quarrel with the government, meant as a nation due to his authority which has done nothing to prevent a whole population from being underwater. In this case, the charge is directed to the whole America, unable to change.
